abstract.t: This document defines the syntax for private key information and a content type for it. Private-key information includes a private key for some public-key algorithm and a set of attributes. The document also describes a syntax for encrypted private keys. The Cryptographic Message Syntax, as defined in RFC 3852, can be used to digitally sign, digest, authenticate, or encrypt the asymmetric key format content type. This document obsoletes RFC 5208.
